question: What is early voting?
phrase: A method of voting that allows eligible voters to cast their ballots before the official election day.
predAns: Early voting, also called advance polling or pre-poll voting, is a convenience voting process by which voters in a public election can vote before Election Day
oriLLMans: Early voting, also called advance polling or pre-poll voting, is a convenience voting process by which voters in a public election can vote before Election Day; [0, 1, 7].
oriSent: Early voting, also known as advance voting, is a method of voting that allows eligible voters to cast their ballots before the official election day.

question: What is absentee voting?
phrase: A form of early voting that allows voters who were unable to vote in person on election day to cast their ballots by mail.
predAns: An absentee ballot is a vote cast by someone who is unable or unwilling to attend the official polling station to which the voter is normally allocated.
oriLLMans: An absentee ballot is a vote cast by someone who is unable or unwilling to attend the official polling station to which the voter is normally allocated.; [5]
oriSent: One of the earliest forms of early voting was absentee voting, which allowed voters who were unable to vote in person on election day to cast their ballots by mail.

question: How has early voting evolved in the US?
predAns: The pandemic led to a historic rise in early voting, as 70% of the electorate cast ballots before Election Day in 2020. In 2022, it looks like early voting will continue to be an important aspect of the electoral process
oriLLMans: The pandemic led to a historic rise in early voting, as 70% of the electorate cast ballots before Election Day in 2020. In 2022, it looks like early voting will continue to be an important aspect of the electoral process; [4].
oriSent: Over the years, early voting has evolved and expanded in the US.
